title: Problem with Picture-in-Picture Functionality
content:
Hi everyone,

I use Firefox as my primary browser for several reasons, but the main one is because it has the best Picture-in-Picture (PiP) feature. However, I no longer use Windows and have encountered problems with it on various Linux distributions (Ubuntu, Fedora, Debian...). Currently, I'm only using Fedora 40, and the problem persists.

The issue is that when I click on the PiP icon, it activates normally, but when I switch windows or minimize and then maximize Firefox again, the video disappears.

I will attach some screenshots to clarify the issue.

I would like to know if there is any way to resolve this. I’ve already reset the settings, cleared the cache, and tested different installation methods (software store, .tar.bz file, apt, dnf, snap). I’ve tried troubleshooting mode and even installed the Developer Edition, but the problem persists. I’m wondering if this is an issue with the Linux version of Firefox.

Thank you.
creator: caiochaves0610

title: Firefox 128.0.3 over Ubuntu Cinnamon 22.04 doesn't accept inputs with accents! Not a newbie problem!
content:
I'm using Firefox 128.0.3 on Ubuntu Cinnamon 22.04 in Brazilian Portuguese and everything was working fine until an update made 2 weeks ago.

After that, Firefox does not accept any input that contains accents, such as tilde, grave accent, acute or circumflex. All other software accepts them, the keyboard layout and regional settings are all correct, since Chrome and Opera accept accented input normally. I've already investigated the page source code, Firefox settings, corrected charset but nothing seems to be wrong.

I can't create another account because I have a lot of important information synchronized in the account.

Could someone tell me where I should start investigating?

Thanks in advance for your attention.

title: Cookiebot consent popup justifiably blocked by Enhanced Tracking Protection settings?
content:
If you open this website: https://www.zonnebloem.nl/ with the option Enhanced Tracking Protection the cookiebot popup banner is not shown as the third party tracking cookie from domain https://consent.cookiebot.com is protected and NOT loaded.

Does this mean Mozilla Firefox sees the https://consent.cookiebot.com cookie as a third party tracking cookie that needs to be blocked as nobody gave consent to load the cookiebot consent popup?

Question 1: Is according to Mozilla Firefox https://consent.cookiebot.com a third party tracking cookie that needs to be blocked if you as a user want to have guarantees over your privacy online?

Question 2: Is it not strange to see Firefox blocking a widely used cookie consent system to protect users by giving consent to select which cookies will be set yes/no?

title: ⨹{[qB 8360]}How Do I SPEAk to Real Person at (((φ(QuickBooks Desktop Support)φ)))🄲🄰🄻🄻 🅄🅂 🅀🄱
content:
⨹{[qB 8360]}How Do I SPEAk to Real Person at (((φ(QuickBooks Desktop Support)φ)))🄲🄰🄻🄻 🅄🅂 🅀🄱

1. What is the QuickBooks Desktop Support number?

The QuickBooks Desktop Support number is 1-805-619-9337. This line connects you with support representatives who can assist with issues related to QuickBooks Desktop software, whether you're dealing with installation problems, software errors, or need help with advanced features.

2. How can I contact QuickBooks Desktop Support?

To reach QuickBooks Desktop Support, simply call 1-805-619-9337. This number is dedicated to helping users with QuickBooks Desktop issues. If you prefer, you can also explore their online support options, such as live chat or support tickets through the QuickBooks website.

3. What kinds of problems can QuickBooks Desktop Support help with?

QuickBooks Desktop Support can assist with a variety of issues, including software installation problems, data file corruption, reconciliation errors, and general troubleshooting. If you’re experiencing difficulties with your QuickBooks Desktop functions or features, their support team is there to help.

4. Is QuickBooks Desktop Support available 24/7?

QuickBooks Desktop Support is not available 24/7. Their standard hours are typically Monday through Friday, from 6 AM to 6 PM PT. For specific availability, it's best to check their website or call the support number for the most accurate information.

To contact QuickBooks Payroll support by phone, simply dial their toll-free number: +1-805-619-9337 [INTUIT] this will connect you with a QuickBooks Payroll representative who can assist you with any inquiries. To speak to a representative at QuickBooks, dial #1-805-619-9337 or 📞 +1-(805)-619-9337.

5. Can I reach QuickBooks Desktop Support by email?

While phone support is available through 1-805-619-9337, QuickBooks Desktop Support also offers assistance via email. However, for quicker responses, calling the support number is generally recommended. You can usually find an email contact form on the QuickBooks website.

6. Are there any charges for QuickBooks Desktop Support?

Basic support is often included with your QuickBooks Desktop subscription. However, there might be charges for more advanced technical assistance or support for complex issues. Check your subscription details or contact QuickBooks directly to understand any potential costs.

title: ¿Cómo hablar con una persona real en Volaris?[#𝚝𝚎𝚕𝚎𝚏𝚘𝚗𝚘]
content: ¡Hola! Para hablar con una persona real en Volaris, +52 (5) 568263004 tienes varias opciones. Puedes llamar al servicio al cliente al número de teléfono oficial de la aerolínea y seguir las instrucciones para comunicarte con un representante +52 (5) 568263004. También puedes visitar el mostrador de atención al cliente en el aeropuerto si estás allí en persona. Recuerda tener a mano tu número de reservación y cualquier otra información relevante para agilizar el proceso.
creator: bakersusan521

title: I want to save annotated PDFs right away
content:
I open PDF from my files system or an app (Zotero f.e.). I make annotations since the annotation tools in Firefox are nice. Just a few highlights, maybe comment, underlines, whatever. I want to save the file and quit Firefox.

BUT - Firefox doesn't automatically save the opened file but rather wants me to "save as" a new file to be downloaded and chosen to be saved somewhere specificaly. I cannot just "save", I have to "save as" like I would download or create a new file.

I don't want to create new downloaded file to save somewhere else. I want to save annotations and such changes directly to the original file so I can just hop in and out of the file when I want to continue reading or edit annotations f.e..

MS Edge let's you save the changes to the file right to the original file so you can just hit "save" (ctrl+s) and close the window.

Hopefuly my question for clarification is somewhat understandable.

Thank you for your time
creator: hokutzigurat

title: Middle mouse click on link in folder on bookmark bar closes folder, how to prevent folder closing?
content:
As the subject says, when i middle mouse click on a link to open it in a new tab in a folder on the bookmark bar, the folder closes, which is annoyign when i want to opne multiple pages. How do i prevent this folder closing?

Also the "When you open a link, image or media in a new tab, switch to it immediately" check mark doesnt seem to work when it comes to the adresse bar. Firefox will switch to any page i middle mouse click in my bookmark bar with this setting UNCHECKED. I fixed this wrong behavior by setting this option "browser.tabs.loadBookmarksInBackground" to TRUE in the "about:config" settings page.

I also want to add that this problem is recent. I've been using firefox for a few years and only since one of the recent updates (dont know which one) has this problem occured. I assume it's a bug since such inconsistent "setting options to actual ui behavior" is laughable.
creator: pete.caution

title: Exclude address saving from specific websites
content: Hi. I'm an admin using web based school class scheduling software. I have to go into student and instructor records frequently where their personal info is displayed in the form of filled in fields on a web page. Every time I exit a student/instructor contact page, firefox asks me if I want to save their addresses. Obviously I don't want to do this with other peoples info, but I'd still like to autofill addresses for my own private browsing. Is there a way I can exclude only the class scheduling website from address autofill/autosave without shutting the function off entirely for all my other browsing? Thanks .
creator: bengreen1935

title: IHG.com not working again
content:
Similar to this thread: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1437649

At the time removing the enhanced protection worked. Now not able to login to the site again. It goes to login, and then results in me not being logged in and asking for credentials again.

I've turned off all my ad blockers & privacy extensions for this domain (Disconnect, uBlock Origin, decentraleyes, cookie auto-delete, clearurls) as welll as having enhanced protection off.

Still doesn't work on Firefox, but fine on other browsers

title: Secure Connection Failed
content:
After years of using Firefox and accessing my grocery store online for the weekly ad and specials it suddenly says shows me this when I try to open the website:

Secure Connection Failed

An error occurred during a connection to www.dillons.com. 

   The page you are trying to view cannot be shown because the authenticity of the received data could not be verified.    Please contact the website owners to inform them of this problem.

When I look for solutions it tells me there is no way to allow this website to open now. What is going on? I don't care if it's a secure connection, it's just a grocery store ad.

title: How to keep FF from closing when closing last tab?
content:
howdy y'all,

ff = 128.03 os = win11 extensions = problem still there when all off

when i close the last tab ... firefox closes. [*sigh*] way back when [several years ago], i could close all the tabs quickly and still have FF open and ready to go to my next site.

how can i get FF to behave as i want? [*grin*]

take care, rld
creator: a.RichardLeeDailey
